acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=0.89mg/L of the fish (Carp) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2005).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification cannot be determined, though the available rat inhalation study reported the LC50 value of >0.28mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 1,644mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no evidence of treatment-related incidence of tumor formation observed in rat/mouse carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=3.69(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 111-112degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in micronucleus tests on mouse bone marrow cells, though in vitro reverse mutation tests showed negative whereas in vitro chromosome aberration tests gave false positive results (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984, 1989, 1992)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine and oxygen (but not fluorine), with the chlorine and oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on parental reproduction and offspring development observed in rat 2-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test method applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 111-112degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data), test temperature: 140degC).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of mild irritation reactions which were fully reversed within 3 days, observed in rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on no evidence of irritation observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea pig sensitization tests employing the Buehler method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (pancreas)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)): "atrophic changes of pancreatic exocrine cells" observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "tetraplegia," "reduced activity," "staggering," "lacrimation," "blood-like gum along the lid-margin," "piloerection," "emaciation," "gait disturbance" and "coma" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.
